item.title: Providing for further consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 22) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

latestAction.text: ORDER OF BUSINESS - Mr. Woodall asked unanimous consent that during further consideration of the Senate amendments to H.R. 22, pursuant to H.Res. 512, amendment number 23 printed in part B of House Report 114-326 may be considered as though printed immediately following amendment number 9 in part B of such report. Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 248 - 171 (Roll no. 584).
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 248 - 171 (Roll no. 584).
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 241 - 178 (Roll no. 583). (consideration: CR H7410-7411)
ORDERING THE PREVIOUS QUESTION - Mr. Woodall moved the previous question on the amendment and on the resolution.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 507.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: H7403-7412; text of measure as reported in House: CR H7403)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 71.

Resolution provides for consideration of the Senate amendments to H.R. 22; provides for proceedings during the period from Nov. 6, 2015 through Nov. 13, 2015; and provides for motions to suspend the rules.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-325, by Mr. Woodall.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-325, by Mr. Woodall.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 22) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act; providing for proceedings during the period from November 6, 2015, through November 13, 2015; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.
Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 22 (Developing a Reliable and Innovative Vision for the Economy Act [DRIVE Act]).

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 22) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act; providing for proceedings during the period from November 6, 2015, through November 13, 2015; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

amendment.description: An amendment to make technical and procedural changes to the text of H. Res. 507.
amendment.purpose: Amendment makes technical and clarifying changes to the text of H. Res. 507.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Woodall amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
